analyzed: aita 'gro ba ma yin pa sogs kyis na phyis pas /
translated: with ita, a non-goer and so on, na is added.

original: da shy'ata / da shy'ast'am /
analyzed: da shy'ata / da shy'ast'am /
translated: With daś, daśyāt and daśyās are made.

original: da shy'a su:sogs so //
analyzed: da shy'a su:sogs so //
translated: With daśyus, daśyus and so on are made.🔽In the causative,

original: lrit la / brashdza bhrasdza sogs kyis sha sha /
analyzed: lrit la / brashdza bhrasdza sogs kyis sha sha /
translated: with bhrāsja and bhrāsja, śaś is made.

original: sa la sha dha dag gi ka / kun nas bsgyur ba sogs kyis sa sha byas pas /🔽dam kshya ti /
analyzed: sa la sha dha dag gi ka / kun nas bsgyur ba sogs kyis sa sha byas pas / dam kshya ti /
translated: With śala and śadha, ka is made. With the all-around transformation and so on, śaś is made.

original: dam kshya ta:/ dam kshyanti sogs so //
analyzed: dam kshya ta:/ dam kshyanti sogs so //
translated: With dam and kṣayat, dam and kṣayat are made.🔽With dam and kṣayat, dam and kṣayat, dam and kṣayanti are made.

original: de bzhin du /🔽lring la'ang / aa dam kshyata /
analyzed: de bzhin du / lring la'ang / aa dam kshyata /
translated: In the same way,🔽with lṛṅ, adam and kṣayat,

original: aa dam kshya t'am /
analyzed: aa dam kshya t'am /
translated: adam and kṣayat,

original: aa dam kshyana sogs so //
analyzed: aa dam kshyana sogs so //
translated: adam and kṣayanti are made.🔽In the imperative,

original: guptidzkidbhya:san / gup ti dza kita rnams las sana'o //
analyzed: guptidzkidbhya:san / gup ti dza kita rnams las sana'o //
translated: with guptī and jakit, san is made.

original: byings gu p'u sbed pa dang smad pa dag la 'o dang / ti dza rno ba la ste bzod pa la yang ngo dang / kita nges par gnas pa la ste nad sel bar byed pa la yang ngo zhes pa'i byings gsum la san pha rol tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: byings gu p'u sbed pa dang smad pa dag la 'o dang / ti dza rno ba la ste bzod pa la yang ngo dang / kita nges par gnas pa la ste nad sel bar byed pa la yang ngo zhes pa'i byings gsum la san pha rol tu 'gyur te /
translated: The three roots gu, pu, and spha, when they are in the sense of “to praise” and “to blame,” have o.

original: san gyi na yig ni san yang dag la'o zhes byings gnyis brjod pa'i don no //
analyzed: san gyi na yig ni san yang dag la'o zhes byings gnyis brjod pa'i don no //
translated: The letter ṇa of ṇa is the meaning of the two roots gu and pu, which are expressed as “to praise.”🔽Saṇya doḥ.

original: sa n+ya do:san yang dag la'o //
analyzed: sa n+ya do:san yang dag la'o //
translated: Saṇ is in the sense of “to praise.”

original: san dang yang dag pha rol la byings aa bhy'a sa med pa'i gnyis @238b brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: san dang yang dag pha rol la byings aa bhy'a sa med pa'i gnyis @238b brjod par bya'o //
translated: Saṇ and “to praise” are the two roots abhyāsa.🔽Pūrvasaṇ.

original: p'urbat+sa na:/ san gyi snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: p'urbat+sa na:/ san gyi snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: Saṇ is the same as before.🔽The ṇa at the end of saṇ, which is given in the root, is the same as before, so it is said that the root remains as a root.

original: byings la san byin pa'i san gyi mtha' yang snga ma dang 'dra ba ste byings nyid du gnas pas byings byings su bsgrub pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byings la san byin pa'i san gyi mtha' yang snga ma dang 'dra ba ste byings nyid du gnas pas byings byings su bsgrub pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
translated: The root is called “the condition for establishing the root.”

original: 'grel par lung drangs pa /
analyzed: 'grel par lung drangs pa /
translated: The passage quoted in the commentary is:

original: gu p'a de:gra m'annint'aksha ma rugdza ye shu sanni shya te /
analyzed: gu p'a de:gra m'annint'aksha ma rugdza ye shu sanni shya te /
translated: Gupadet, grāmānnintakṣa marugjayeshusanniśyate.

original: gupa sogs las rim pa bzhin smad pa bzod pa nad sel ba rnams las na 'dod do //
analyzed: gupa sogs las rim pa bzhin smad pa bzod pa nad sel ba rnams las na 'dod do //
translated: The suffix san and so on are asserted to be, respectively, the suffix for the root gu, the suffix for the root ti, the suffix for the root ja, and the suffix for the root ki.

original: gong du bshad pa'i gu pa sogs la san 'jug pa de yang rim pa bzhin te /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i gu pa sogs la san 'jug pa de yang rim pa bzhin te /
translated: The suffix san and so on that are added to the roots gu and so on that were explained above are, respectively,

original: byings gu p'u smad pa la 'jug pa dang / ti dza bzod pa la 'jug pa dang / kit nad sel ba la 'jug pa rnams la san 'gyur bar 'dod la /
analyzed: byings gu p'u smad pa la 'jug pa dang / ti dza bzod pa la 'jug pa dang / kit nad sel ba la 'jug pa rnams la san 'gyur bar 'dod la /
translated: the suffix for the root gu, the suffix for the root ti, the suffix for the root ja, and the suffix for the root ki.

original: sbed pa sogs don gzhan la ni 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbed pa sogs don gzhan la ni 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not added to other meanings such as concealment and so on.🔽ki

analyzed: san yang dag la 'os /

analyzed: lat sogs a'atma ne pa da rnams sbyar / cho ga bshad ma thag pa dang 'dra / 'dir sup kyi byings sogs kyi byings kyi dang po'i sha sar mi 'gyur te / lat la / shvashka te / shvashke te / shvashkante sogs so // ling la / shvashke ta / shvashke y'ast'am / shvashke ran sogs so // lot la / shvashka t'am / shvashke t'am / shvashkantam sogs so // lang la / aashvashkata / aashvashke t'am / aa shvashkanta sogs so //
translated: The suffixes lta, etc., are added to ātmanepada forms.🔽The procedure is the same as that just explained.🔽Here, the first syllable of the root sup, etc., does not become śa.🔽With lta, there are śvaśakte,🔽śvaśkete, śvaśkantte, etc.🔽With ling, there are śvaśkete,🔽śvaśkeyāstām, śvaśkeran, etc.🔽With lot, there are śvaśaktām,🔽śvaśketām, śvaśkantām, etc.🔽With lang, there are aśvaśkta,🔽aśvaśketām, aśvaśkantta, etc.🔽🔽

original: lung la / phal dang po'i ait sbyar @242a * //🔽bas / aa shvashkishta /🔽aa shvashki sh'a t'am /🔽aa shvashkasha ta sogs so //🔽lita'i skyes bu dang po gsum la /🔽sha shvashke / sha shvashk'a te /🔽sha shvashki re /🔽skyas bu dbus ma gsum la /🔽sha shvashki she /🔽sha shvashk'a the /🔽sha shvashki dhve /🔽sha shvashki dhve /
analyzed: lung la / phal dang po'i ait sbyar @242a * //🔽bas / aa shvashkishta /🔽aa shvashki sh'a t'am /🔽aa shvashkasha ta sogs so //🔽lita'i skyes bu dang po gsum la /🔽sha shvashke / sha shvashk'a te /🔽sha shvashki re /🔽skyas bu dbus ma gsum la /🔽sha shvashki she /🔽sha shvashk'a the /🔽sha shvashki dhve /🔽sha shvashki dhve /
translated: In the case of the aorist,🔽the first three persons are formed by adding🔽it to the root.🔽For example, aśvaścakāra, aśvaścakāra, aśvaścakrire.🔽For the first three persons of the middle group,🔽aśvaścakīśe, aśvaścakāthe, aśvaścakīre.🔽For the first three persons of the last group,🔽aśvaścakīṣṭa, aśvaścakāthāta, aśvaścakīṣṭa.🔽For the middle three persons of the middle group,🔽aśvaścakīṣi, aśvaścakāthāthe, aśvaścakīṣi.🔽For the middle three persons of the last group,🔽aśvaścakīṣṭa, aśvaścakāthāthā, aśvaścakīṣṭa.🔽

translated: The final a of a root that is not removed by the individual inclusion letters becomes a long vowel. Its function of abhyāsa is like sa before a following ṅ.

original: san+ya ta: san la a'ata kyi'o //
analyzed: san+ya ta: san la a'ata kyi'o //

translated: Before a following sa, the first of the two expressed roots, which is named abhyāsa, becomes āt.

original: skabs 'dir mdo snga phyi gnyis kyis tsi ka mi /
analyzed: skabs 'dir mdo snga phyi gnyis kyis tsi ka mi /
translated: In this context, the two earlier and later sūtras have cīka mi,

original: tsang ta d'irgho la gho:yang ba'i ring po'o //
analyzed: tsang ta d'irgho la gho:yang ba'i ring po'o //
translated: caṅ ta, dīr gho la gho, and yā ba’i ring po.

original: yi ge yang ba'i sngon ma'i aa bhy'a sa'i ni dang tsang pha rol la ring por 'gyur te /
analyzed: yi ge yang ba'i sngon ma'i aa bhy'a sa'i ni dang tsang pha rol la ring por 'gyur te /
translated: The long vowel of the syllable yā becomes ā before the preceding ma, and caṅ becomes long before the following.

original: tsi ring por song /
analyzed: tsi ring por song /
translated: Cī is long.

original: ts'ika mi / tsang ta /
analyzed: ts'ika mi / tsang ta /
translated: Cīka mi, caṅ ta,

original: nar ni ti /
analyzed: nar ni ti /
translated: nā ri,

original: ait ma yin pa la ni'i'o //
analyzed: ait ma yin pa la ni'i'o //
translated: and iṭ ma ya are not.

original: rnam dbye byings phyed pa ait dang po can ma yin pa pha rol la ni dbyi bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam dbye byings phyed pa ait dang po can ma yin pa pha rol la ni dbyi bar bya ste /
translated: The case ending of a half-vowel root that begins with iṭ is not elided before the following,

original: na'i rjes 'brel phyis /
analyzed: na'i rjes 'brel phyis /
translated: because it is connected with nā.

original: tsang gi rjes 'brel nga dang tsa'ang phyis /
analyzed: tsang gi rjes 'brel nga dang tsa'ang phyis /
translated: Because caṅ is connected with ṅa and caṅ,

original: lung lang sogs kyi byings la aat sbyar bas /
analyzed: lung lang sogs kyi byings la aat sbyar bas /
translated: when the root lvaṅ and so on is combined with aṭ,

original: aa ts'i ka ma ta /
analyzed: aa ts'i ka ma ta /
translated: a cīka mat is produced.

original: de bzhin du bsgrubs pas gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /🔽aa ts'i ka me t'am ;
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgrubs pas gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la / aa ts'i ka me t'am ;
translated: In the same way, when it is established for dual and plural,🔽a cīka me tāṃ

original: aa ts'ika manta /
analyzed: aa ts'ika manta /
translated: a cīka manta

original: lung gi skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /🔽aa ts'a ka ma th'a:/
analyzed: lung gi skyes bu dbus ma gsum la / aa ts'a ka ma th'a:/
translated: is produced for the three central persons of the statement.🔽a cāka matā🔽a cīka me tāṃ

original: aa ts'i ka me th'am /🔽aa ts'i ka ma dhvam /
analyzed: aa ts'i ka me th'am / aa ts'i ka ma dhvam /
translated: a cīka ma dhmā

original: skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
analyzed: skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
translated: is produced for the three latter persons.

original: aa ts'i ka me /🔽aa ts'i ka m'a ba hi /
analyzed: aa ts'i ka me / aa ts'i ka m'a ba hi /
translated: ācāmakam🔽ācāmavahi

original: aa ts'i ka m'a ma hi /
analyzed: aa ts'i ka m'a ma hi /
translated: ācāmamahī

original: a'a ya la sogs pa rnams byings phyed pa la yang na'o zhes pa'i mdos ning ma byin pa'i phyogs la ;
analyzed: a'a ya la sogs pa rnams byings phyed pa la yang na'o zhes pa'i mdos ning ma byin pa'i phyogs la ;
translated: The suffix -a is added to āya and so on, because of the sūtra “The half-r is added to the a class.”

original: 'grel par ni med pa la'ang tsli tsang 'o zhes bshad pas /🔽aa tsa ka ma ta /
analyzed: 'grel par ni med pa la'ang tsli tsang 'o zhes bshad pas / aa tsa ka ma ta /
translated: In the commentary it is explained that -a is added to the non-existent.🔽ācakamaṭ

original: aa tsa ka me t'am /
analyzed: aa tsa ka me t'am /
translated: ācakamaṭam

original: aa tsa ka manta sogs so //
analyzed: aa tsa ka manta sogs so //
translated: ācakamaṇta and so on.

original: lit la / k'a sa sogs kyi k'a mi la a'am sbyar /
analyzed: lit la / k'a sa sogs kyi k'a mi la a'am sbyar /
translated: To lit, the ka of kāsa and so on, -a is added.

original: k'a mi / a'ama /
analyzed: k'a mi / a'ama /
translated: kāmi

original: lit / a'ama la 'os /🔽lit 'jig / aa y'a mant'a lv'a byetnishnu shu /
analyzed: lit / a'ama la 'os / lit 'jig / aa y'a mant'a lv'a byetnishnu shu /
translated: -a is suitable for lit.🔽lit🔽āyamantālavyabhedaniśuśu

original: a'ama mtha' a'a lu @245b a'a pya aitnu aishnu rnams la aa ya'o //
analyzed: a'ama mtha' a'a lu @245b a'a pya aitnu aishnu rnams la aa ya'o //
translated: -a at the end of āma, ālu, āpya, itanu, iśanu, becomes -aya.

original: a'ama mtha' dang krita sogs kyi rkyen a'a lu /
analyzed: a'ama mtha' dang krita sogs kyi rkyen a'a lu /
translated: -a at the end and the condition kṛt and so on, ālu,

original: a'a pya / aitnu /
analyzed: a'a pya / aitnu /
translated: āpya, itanu,

original: aishnu rnams pha rol la ni'i mtha' can ni aa ya zhes par 'gyur te /🔽k'a ma y'am tsakre /
analyzed: aishnu rnams pha rol la ni'i mtha' can ni aa ya zhes par 'gyur te / k'a ma y'am tsakre /
translated: iśanu, become -aya at the end of the other.🔽kāmayāṃ cakre

original: k'a ma y'am ba bh'u ba /
analyzed: k'a ma y'am ba bh'u ba /
translated: kāmayāṃ babhūva

original: k'a ma y'a m'a sa sogs so //
analyzed: k'a ma y'a m'a sa sogs so //
translated: kāmayāmāsa and so on.

original: ning ma byin pa'i phyogs la /
analyzed: ning ma byin pa'i phyogs la /
translated: In the case of not adding -a,

original: tsa ka me /🔽tsa ka m'a the /
analyzed: tsa ka me / tsa ka m'a the /
translated: Cakame.🔽Cakamathe.

original: tsa ka mi re /
analyzed: tsa ka mi re /
translated: Cakamire.

original: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /
analyzed: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /
translated: To the three middle persons:

original: tsa ka mi shi /🔽tsa ka m'a the /🔽tsa ka mi dhve /
analyzed: tsa ka mi shi / tsa ka m'a the / tsa ka mi dhve /
translated: Cakamishi.🔽Cakamathe.🔽Cakamidhve.

original: tsa ka mi dhre /
analyzed: tsa ka mi dhre /
translated: Cakamidhre.

original: skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
analyzed: skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
translated: To the three last persons:

original: tsa ka me /🔽tsa ka mi ba he /
analyzed: tsa ka me / tsa ka mi ba he /
translated: Cakame.🔽Cakamivadhe.

original: tsa ka mi ma he /
analyzed: tsa ka mi ma he /
translated: Cakamimahe.

original: lut la ning sbyar ba'i phyogs la /
analyzed: lut la ning sbyar ba'i phyogs la /
translated: In the case of applying the neuter:🔽Kamāyitatā, etc.

original: k'a ma yi t'a sogs dang / ning ma sbyar ba'i phyogs la /
analyzed: k'a ma yi t'a sogs dang / ning ma sbyar ba'i phyogs la /
translated: In the case of not applying the neuter:

original: ka mi t'a sogs so //
analyzed: ka mi t'a sogs so //
translated: Kamitā, etc.

original: ning sbyar ba'i phyogs kyi smon pa'i ling la /
analyzed: ning sbyar ba'i phyogs kyi smon pa'i ling la /
translated: In the case of applying the neuter to the optative ending:🔽Kamāyīṣṭa, etc.

original: k'a ma yi sh'ishta sogs dang / ning ma sbyar ba'i phyogs la /
analyzed: k'a ma yi sh'ishta sogs dang / ning ma sbyar ba'i phyogs la /
translated: In the case of not applying the neuter:

original: ka mi sh'ishta sogs so //
analyzed: ka mi sh'ishta sogs so //
translated: Kamīṣṭa, etc.

original: lrit la ning sbyar ba'i phyogs la /
analyzed: lrit la ning sbyar ba'i phyogs la /
translated: In the case of applying the neuter to the ending of the imperative:🔽Kamāyīṣṭe, etc.

original: k'a ma yi shya te sogs dang / ning ma byin pa'i phyogs la /
analyzed: k'a ma yi shya te sogs dang / ning ma byin pa'i phyogs la /
translated: In the case of not giving the neuter:

original: ka mishya te sogs so //
analyzed: ka mishya te sogs so //
translated: Kamīṣṭe, etc.

original: de bzhin du ning sbyar ba'i phyogs kyi lring la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ning sbyar ba'i phyogs kyi lring la /
translated: In the same way, in the case of applying the neuter to the ending of the imperative:🔽Akāmayīṣṭa, etc.

original: aa k'a ma yi shya ta sogs dang / ning ma sbyar ba'i phyogs la /
analyzed: aa k'a ma yi shya ta sogs dang / ning ma sbyar ba'i phyogs la /
translated: In the case of not applying the neuter:

original: aa ka mi shya ta sogs so /
analyzed: aa ka mi shya ta sogs so /
translated: Akamīṣṭa, etc.

original: ` / aa ya 'gro ba la'o zhes pa la lat sogs sbyar bas /🔽lat la / aa ya te sogs so //🔽ling la / aa yi ta sogs so //
analyzed: ` / aa ya 'gro ba la'o zhes pa la lat sogs sbyar bas / lat la / aa ya te sogs so // ling la / aa yi ta sogs so //
translated: In the case of the word aya meaning going, when it is combined with lat and so forth,🔽 it becomes ayate and so forth in the case of lat,

original: lot la / aa ya t'am sogs so //🔽lang la / a'a ya ta sogs so //🔽lung la / a'a yishta sogs so //
analyzed: lot la / aa ya t'am sogs so // lang la / a'a ya ta sogs so // lung la / a'a yishta sogs so //

original: da y'a y'a sashtsa /
analyzed: da y'a y'a sashtsa /
translated: it becomes ayistha and so forth in the case of lung,🔽 and dayayāśca

original: da ya aa ya a'asa las kyang ngo //
analyzed: da ya aa ya a'asa las kyang ngo //

original: da ya sbyin pa aa ya 'gro ba a'asa nye bar sdod pa rnams las kyang lit pha rol la a'am sbyor bar bya ste /
analyzed: da ya sbyin pa aa ya 'gro ba a'asa nye bar sdod pa rnams las kyang lit pha rol la a'am sbyor bar bya ste /

original: aa ya la lit a'am sogs kyis bsgrubs pas /🔽aa y'am tsakre /
analyzed: aa ya la lit a'am sogs kyis bsgrubs pas / aa y'am tsakre /

original: aa y'am ba bh'u ba /
analyzed: aa y'am ba bh'u ba /
translated: ayāṃ babhūva,

original: aa y'a m'a sa sogs so //
analyzed: aa y'a m'a sa sogs so //

original: lut la / wal dang po'i ait yin pas /
analyzed: lut la / wal dang po'i ait yin pas /

original: aa yi t'a sogs so //
analyzed: aa yi t'a sogs so //

original: smon pa'i ling la /
analyzed: smon pa'i ling la /
translated: In the case of the optative ling,

original: aa yi sh'ishta sogs so //🔽lrit la / aa yi shya te sogs so //
analyzed: aa yi sh'ishta sogs so // lrit la / aa yi shya te sogs so //

analyzed: lring la / a'a yi shya ta sogs so //

original: au pa sarga sy'a ya too /
analyzed: au pa sarga sy'a ya too /

original: nyer bsgyur gyi aa ya ti la'o //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur gyi aa ya ti la'o //

translated: The prefix ra becomes la in the sense of “to the other side.”

analyzed: pa r'a ya la /

original: lang la / aa sph'a ya ta sogs so //
analyzed: lang la / aa sph'a ya ta sogs so //

analyzed: lung sogs wal dang po rnams la ait yang na bar bya ste /

analyzed: 'grel par lung drangs pa /

analyzed: ts'a ya sph'a ya py'a y'a mi dv'a /

analyzed: ts'a ya sph'a ya by'a ya rnams kyi ait yang na'o //

original: ts'a yri mchod pa /
analyzed: ts'a yri mchod pa /
translated: cayasya is worship.

original: sph'a y'i dang ao py'a y'i 'phel ba rnams kyi lit ma gtogs pa'i wal dang po la ait yang na bar bya ste /
analyzed: sph'a y'i dang ao py'a y'i 'phel ba rnams kyi lit ma gtogs pa'i wal dang po la ait yang na bar bya ste /
translated: For the first of the aphorisms of sphāya and opayāya, add ita or ya, except for lita.

original: lung la / ait sbyar ba'i phyogs la /🔽aa sph'a yishta /
analyzed: lung la / ait sbyar ba'i phyogs la / aa sph'a yishta /
translated: In the case of adding ita to the scripture,🔽asphāyiṣṭa.

original: aa sph'a yi sh'a t'am /
analyzed: aa sph'a yi sh'a t'am /
translated: asphāyiṣṭām.

analyzed: srog chags ma yin pa la aa nu bi pa ri aa bhi ni rnams las syanda te'i 'o //

analyzed: srog chags ma yin pa la 'jug pa na nyer bsgyur aa nu la sogs pa 'di rnams las /

analyzed: syanda te yis yig ni sha yig tu yang na 'gyur te / aa nu shyanda te ra tha:sogs sam /

original: aa nu syanda te ra tha:sogs so //
analyzed: aa nu syanda te ra tha:sogs so //

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /

original: bi / pa ri /
analyzed: bi / pa ri /

analyzed: aabhi / ni rnams kyang sbyar bar bya'o //

original: srog chags ma yin pa zhes pas rnams bcad kyi srog chags la 'jug pa na shar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog chags ma yin pa zhes pas rnams bcad kyi srog chags la 'jug pa na shar mi 'gyur te /

original: ni syanda te ha st'i /
analyzed: ni syanda te ha st'i /

original: kri p'u'i ra la'o //
analyzed: kri p'u'i ra la'o //

analyzed: kri p'u'i ra yig ni rkyen pha rol la la yig tu bsgyur bar bya la /

analyzed: de yang mtha' gcig tu ni ma nges pas skabs 'gar mi bsgyur ba yang yod do //

analyzed: kri p'u la /

analyzed: lat / (glang chen nges par rgyu/) sha pa /

analyzed: mdo 'di sa ri li /

analyzed: @251b ling la /

analyzed: lang la / aa kalpa ta sogs so //

analyzed: pa rasmee pa da rnams dang a'atma na pa da rnams yang na bar byas pas /

analyzed: smon pa'i ling dang / si tsa a'atma ne pa da can dzhal so sor ba sdu ba'i yi ge dang po can yod pa ste /

analyzed: a'atma ne pa da'i phyogs la a'uta 'gro ba sogs kyis aita yang na bar byas pas /

analyzed: aita byin pa'i phyogs la /

analyzed: kalpt'a / kalpt'a roo /
